title.narrative: Development of a Decision Support Tool for Integrated Coastal Protection in the Mekong Delta

description.narrative: What are the results of the project?The main objective of the DST is to provide information on the performance of various coastal protection options along the Vietnamese coast. Largely based on information and methods practiced in the actual Technical Guideline for sea dikes (TG), the tool helps to enhance system understanding by visualizing current system functioning and the possible impacts of future (external) developments on design water level and wave heights at critical locations. Further, it provides some preliminary insights in the costs and benefits of a varied set of coastal protection options that best suits the needs for protection and its coastal characteristics. This enables comparison on robust and flexible alternatives. The tool is designed for use by specialists, open to be fully adapted to local circumstances. Due to the lack of information, many assumptions have been made in order to be able to make a comprehensive assessment involving all relevant factors. The aim was to include all factors that determine the scope, design, costs and benefits of basic coastal protection schemes. Especially assumptions regarding the development of the foreshore and mangrove bed level (vertical adaptation), land subsidence, dike consolidation and also wave attenuation by mangroves and over muddy foreshores play a major role in the results and require additional research. All these factors, as well as the wave transmission over breakwaters, determine the wave height at the toe of the dike, and as a consequence also its design and costs. However, also the functional period considered and especially the discount rate applied, also play a major role. An area that certainly needs further exploration is that of flood benefits. So far critical information is lacking on inundation, flood damages curves and more that would allow a meaningful assessment of the damages avoided in the case of coastal protection. The DST shows what factors are very critical and hence also where there are critical gaps in information that need to be closed, in order to improve upon the assessment and comparison of different coastal protection schemes. The tool also provides a second - less technical - interface, to be used for demonstration and policy analysis.
